alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Jackson; Winn (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued November 29 at 3:44PM CST until November 29 at 4:15PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST FOR WESTERN CALDWELL...SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON AND NORTHEASTERN WINN PARISHES... At 344 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located 14 miles northeast of Winnfield, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Clarks, Grayson, Sikes, Vixen and Kelly. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for north central Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
